FuncDef: The display isis spf-tree command displays the topology of the SPT that is generated by IS-IS. The display isis spf-tree command displays the topology of the SPT that is generated by IS-IS.
CLIs: display isis spf-tree [ systemid <systemid> ] [ [ level-1 | level-2 ] | ipv6 | verbose ] [ <process-id> | vpn-instance <vpn-instance-name> ]

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the system ID or pseudo node ID.
The value is in the format of XXXX.XXXX.XXXX[.XX].

Displays the SPT topology of Level-1.
-

Displays the SPT topology of Level-2.
-

Displays the SPT topology of IPv6.

 NOTE: This parameter is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ.
-

Displays detailed information of the SPT topology.
-

Displays the SPT topology of a specified IS-IS process.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4294967295.

Specifies the name of a VPN instance.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters. It cannot contain spaces. The VPN instance name cannot be _public_. If the character string is quoted by double quotation marks, the character string can contain spaces.
